description.narrative: 1) Functional integrated case management system 2) Level of access to justice by citizens 3) Strengthened capacity of the prosecution 4) Percentage of reports submitted timely by national actors as required by human rights bodies 5) Number of CSOs participating in the parallel reporting;

1) 3rd milestone of the Integrated Electronic Case Management System completed (IECMS Modules and software development). 2) 81% 3) 0 4) 100% 5) 25 CSOs

1)The 3rd and 4th milestones have been completed consisting of the development of IECMS modules for the justice institutions as well as the development of the IECMS software. The project management team has also been trained and will train other users. 2) The level of access to justice by citizens has improved, scoring 80.25% in the latest Rwanda Governance Scorecard which was released in 2015. 3) No prosecutors trained in 2015 4) 100% - All due reports to Treaty Bodies and UPR have been submitted at 100% 5) 25 CSOs participated in the preparation of their shadow report for the 2015UPR review for Rwanda.

1) The Integrated Electronic Case management system operational 2) 90 Access to Justice Bureaus officials trained on legal practice 3) 40 prosecutors and judicial police officials trained 4) 100% of TBR due reports submitted on time 4) 5 CSO participating in parallel reporting

The harmonized system for reporting by human rights monitoring institutions is fully utilized, especially the office of the ombudsman and the national Commission for human Rights. 5. 450

description.narrative: Advancing and Sustaining Gender Equality Gains in Rwanda
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

1. Harmonized gender capacity building plan 2. % of National Gender Machinery recommendations developed and submitted for adoption 3. Number of sectors with a gender strategy 4. Number of ministries with gender budget statements 5. Timely submission of national reports on gender.

comment.narrative: 1. 2 new districts with gender sector strategy 2. 30 districts, 14 ministries with gender budget statement 3. 75 % of FFRP members benefited from an induction course , 40 MPs, 21 planners and 14 chief trained in Gender Responsive Budgeting, 4. 4 gender mainstreaming policy briefs/guidelines developed 5. 5 national, 2 international dialogues/events on gender equality and GBV organized 6. 3 sectors and 10 districts with gender profiles

1. The Ministry of Gender and Family Promotion (MIGEPROF)has developed gender strategy for 2 sectors of activities: Private Sector and Local government. Both strategies have been validated by stakeholders but they are still waiting for approval by the MIGEPROF and its partners Ministry of Local Government (MINALOC) and Private Sector Federation. 2. 30 districts and all ministries have developed their gender budget statements for 2014-2015 and 2015-2016 fiscal years 3. Fifty (50) new Parliamentarians members of the Rwanda Women Parliamentary Forum (FFRP) were equipped with required knowledge to play oversight role with gender lens. The knowledge acquired enabled the Members of Parliament to analyze and pass gender sensitive bills and budget starting with the 2014/15 national budget and gender budget statement approval. Over 14 Chief budget managers, 21 planners and budget officers, 28 district staff in charge of gender and family promotion enhanced their skills in gender responsive budgeting through a five day training on Gender Responsive Budgeting. It is expected that the skills acquired will facilitate them to address gender related issues in national and district planning and budgeting processes. This training also contributed to the improvement of the quality of the 2015-2016 Gender budget statement. 4. 3 gender mainstreaming policy briefs/guidelines were developed: GBV Monitoring Guidelines were produced and shared with the CSOs by Gender Monitoring Office (GMO); the Parents evening (Umugoroba wAbabyeyi) guidelines reviewed; and the Familys Performance Contract (IMIHIGO) notebook produced. 5. 7 national and 3 international events on gender equality and GBV have been organized; these are: national events: the National Women Leaders Summit by Ministry of Gender and family Promotion (MIGEPROF); the Dialogue on better coordination and effectiveness of womens empowerment initiatives at provincial level by the Forum for Women Parliamentarians (FFRP), the Di

description.narrative: The project aims at building capacity for local and national government entities and equipping them with skills and tools to deliver on their responsibility to implement government policies, service delivery, and social & economic development.
policy, planning and administration
Strengthened and functional Coordination mechanism Government of government policies and programmes in place

comment.narrative: Weakness in Coordination mechanism during implementation and monitoring of government policies and programmes.

1. The programme will support to enhance the capacity of PM office 2. the 30 Districts by training/coaching the staffs in the mainstreaming of the Monitoring and Evaluation framework during monitoring of government policies and programmes. 3. Support to promote investments and resources mobilization by 10% in the 30 Districts and in Rwanda Development 4. Board (RDB) will be enhanced. 5. A National Qualification and Competency Framework for Rwanda that will enhance coordination of activities of programmes related to capacity building initiatives will be established by National Capacity 6. Building Secretariat (NCBS). 7. Efforts to comprehensively review the Rwandan capital market development will be enhanced through drafting of project legislation and tax framework to support in the financial sector development through Ministry of Finance.

1. An Evaluation National policy at the Prime Ministers' office has been drafted. 2. District coaches supported the review and improvement in the quality of the Districts annual plans and budgets for the financial year 2015/2016. 3. Communications and advocacy strategy for the National Statistical System (NSS) The ICT technical advisor at National Institute of Statistics (NISR). 4. project dubbed Building a Regional Business and Financial Centre for Eastern and Central Africa has been developed in Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning (MINECOFIN). 5. Investment experts at RDB mapped potential investors and branding Rwanda as an investment and tourism destination.
